title: Sinusoidal Function - Identify Period from Graph

content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 sin open parentheses 4 x close parentheses plus cos open parentheses 2 x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Using the period of <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, which of the following is the number of complete cycles of the graph of <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane on the interval <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 1000"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1000</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
